gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: When using this data set, it should be bibliographically referred to as 'GISCO NUTS 2010'. The 'GISCO NUTS 2010' dataset represents the NUTS regions by means of region, arc and point topology. The NUTS geographical information is completed by attribute tables and a set of cartographic help lines to better visualize multipart polygonal regions. The NUTS nomenclature is a hierarchical classification of statistical regions defined by Eurostat. The NUTS classification subdivides the EU economic territory into 3 statistical levels. The Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) was enforced the 11 July 2003. This regulation provided the NUTS classification with a legal background. Since then, 12 new countries joined the European Union. The NUTS regulation was officially enforced in these 12 countries the day of their accession to the EU. A non official NUTS-like classification has been defined for the EFTA countries, Croatia, FYROM and Turkey. For further information about the NUTS classification please check the RAMON Eurostat site at http://ec.europa.eu/comm/eurostat/ramon/nuts/home_regions_en.html At present, six scale ranges (100K, 1M, 3M, 10M and 20M, 60M) are maintained in the GISCO geodatabase. The polygon and boundary classes delineate the regions while the points provide a label for each region. Associated tables contain basic information such as the region's name.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Data on administrative boundaries represent a fundamental element of almost any GIS. In the context of the GISCO information system, the NUTS boundaries data are a vital part of the geographic framework, providing means for registering data to regional territories. Equally, national and regional boundaries are essential components of the cartographic backdrop giving a recognisable geographic context to cartographic outputs.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Directive 20007/.../EC/ of the European parliament and of the Council of establishing an Infrastructure for Spatial Information in the European Community (INSPIRE)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This dataset has been created for cartographic purposes.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Usage of data is restricted to specific conditions, that can be found on the data download page and in the metadata for each individual class and table.

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Address to the point of contact specified in this metadata

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes should be present

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: All feature classes, attribute tables and relationship classes are present

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The integrity and cardinality of the relationships (conceptual and implemented) was checked by enforcing primary and foreign key integrity constraints in Oracle. The constraints referencing coded value domain tables were a test of domain consistency.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Errors will show during creation of integrity constraints in Oracle. Constraints will not be applicable in case of violations to the consistency.

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No errors occurred, so the integrity of all primary and foreign keys was confirmed. All the values of each coded value attribute are compliant to the domains (except for any NULL values). The cardinality can only be confirmed where it is strict enough for this test to detect errors.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of NUTS region feature class for all scales and nuts levels

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_RG_2010 regions of the same level should not overlap each other

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency of NUTS boundary features class for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_BN_2010 boundaries must not have dangles, must not overlap, must not self-intersect, must not intersect or touch interior and must be singlepart

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Consistency between NUTS regions and NUTS boundaries for all scales

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_BN_2010 Must be covered by boundary of NUTS_RG_2010

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_BN_nnM_2010 Must be covered by feature class of COMM_BN_nnM_2010

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: Errors in Scotland (GRO), Turkey and FYROM but these are known exceptions.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_LB_2010 Must be properly inside a polygon in NUTS_RG_nnM_2010 with the same NUTS_ID

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real errors found, all indicated labels outside a region belong to archipelagos

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_RG_nnM_2010: Boundary must be covered by COMM_BN_nnM_2010

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: Errors in Scotland (GRO), Turkey and FYROM but these are known exceptions.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: NUTS_CNTR_nnM_2010: Area boundary must be covered by boundary of CNTR_RG_nnM_2010

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: No real topology errors identified. See QC report.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: This dataset (together with the other datasets: NUTS_2010, CNTR_2010, COMM_2010, EEZ_2010 and COAS_2010) is based on geometry of EuroBoundaryMap (EBM) v5.0. from EuroGeographics (scale of 1:100.000), completed with data from the Global Administrative Unit Layer (GAUL) 2008 country data from UN/FAO, data from the National Statistical Institute of Turkey (TurkStat) and the General Register Office for Scotland (GRO) . This resulted in a common repository of geometry of which the different datasets were derived. The different scale levels were derived of generalizations of the common repository on 100K scale. This means that within each scale level the feature classes of all these datasets: COMM_2010, NUTS_2010, CNTR_2010 and COAS_2010, are fully coherent and compliant. The NUTS_2010 dataset consists of 3 feature classes (regions labels and boundaries) per scale level (100k, 1M, 3M, 10M, 20M, 60M). The boundaries and regions are related to each other through a relationship table. The 5 small scale feature classes should be used exclusively for cartographic purposes. Apart from the 12 above mentioned feature classes there is also a label feature class (scale independent). This labelpoint feature class was created with a label inside each NUTS region at the 4 NUTS levels (0 - 3). In addition two line feature classes were created: one feature class for cartograhic joiners to identify where NUTS areas have one or more enclaves and a second line feature class for cartographic separators, to identify where the NUTS limits are in the archipelagos. The arcs of two latter feature classes are only useful for cartographic purposes and are not meant to identify actual administrative or statistical boundaries stretching into the sea or any other significance.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: (i) Eurogeographics EBM v5.0.(scale 1:100K) (ii) GAUL 2008 country level data (iii) NSI of TR for the Turkish features (v) GRO (General Register Office for Scotland) -- for scale level 100K (vi) NUTS nomenclature supplied by EUROSTAT -- for all scale levels

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS)
